trial_identification.studytitle: Neuro Psycho Physical Optimization with Conveyer of Modulating Radiance (CMR) in patients with stress-related pychophysiologic sensations.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Neuro Psycho Physical Optimization with Conveyer of Modulating Radiance (CMR) in patients with stress-related psychophysiologic sensations. A randomised controlled trial to evaluate the effectiveness.

interventions.interventions: The intervention comprises: A cycle of Neuro Psycho Physical Optimization (NPPO) with Conveyer of Modulating Radiance (CMR therapy). The CMR is a biomedical radiofrequency instrument. The protocol used, called Neuro Psycho Physical Optimization (ONPF), involves the application of a probe of the CMR on specific points of the auricular pavilion for an activation time of roughly 500 mms. The ONPF protocol is activated in a precise sequence on seven auricular points. The protocol envisages 18 sessions of ONPF treatment on alternating days, for eight (8)weeks. Assessment, at baseline and at the end of treatment, with Psychological Stress Measure Test (validated in Italian).
interventions.comparator: The reduction of the subjective perception of stress and stress-related pychophysiologic sensations after an NPPO cycle with CMR device, shows significant results (P<.05), respect to a control group that was treated with inactivated CMR.

primaryOutcome.outcome: To test with Psychological Stress Measure if the use of the Conveyer of Modulating Radiance (CMR) - is effective in reducing the subjective perception of stress and stress-related pychophysiologic sensations.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At time zero and after the cycle of therapy, around two months.

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At time zero and after the cycle of therapy, around two months.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Subjects with Psychological Stress Measure Test positive for psychophysiologic sensations.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Subjects with psychophysiologic symptoms in psychiatric - organic diseases or aged less than 18 years of age were excluded.

trial_design.concealment: The subjects, concealed way, was allocated randomly to treatment or control group by an external operator.
trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation by an external operator - computerised sequence generation.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: A high proportion of patients with emotional problems present only psychophysiologic sensations indicative of general distress. These symptoms are medically unexplained and difficult to treat. In this study we have use the Psychological Stress Misure validated in Italian) to test the effectiveness of Neuro Psycho Physical Optimization (NPPO) with Conveyer of Modulating Radiance - CMR Therapy in reducing the subjective perception of stress and stress-related psychophysiologic sensations. The reduction of the symptomatology of stress and stress-related psychophysiologic sensations after an NPPO cycle with CMR therapy shows significant results (P<.05) with respect to a control group that was treated with inactivated CRM.
